Posts.Title: Bone mets - what does it feel like? isharli decaffdave

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2007 06:06PM Patinpa wrote: BEING NEW HERE I HESITATE TO MAKE COMMENT BUT BEING A LONG TIME SURVIVOR, 23YEARS SINCE LEFT BREAST MASTECTOMY, AND NOW HAVING METASTATIC DISEASE TO THE STERNUM, I HAVE TO AGREE WITH WINDY. ALL THOSE EONS AGO MY SURGEON, DID NOT HAVE AN ONC BACK THEN, ANSWERED MY QUESTION OF HOW LONG DO YOU THINK I HAVE, WITH "DO NOT LOOK AT THE STATS BECAUSE YOU ARE NOT A NUMBER ON A PIECE OF PAPER, YOU ARE AN INDIVIDUAL AND WILL SURVIVE". THIS HAS ALWAYS BEEN MY THOUGHT ABOUT STATS, THEY CAN BE MADE INTO ANYTHING ANYONE WANTS THEM TO BE AND I CHOOSE NOT TO BE A PART OF THEM. SOME MIGHT SAY ITS DENIAL BUT IF IT HAS WORKED FOR ME ALL THESE YEARS I INTEND TO CONTINUE TO THINK THAT WAY.
Posts.Title: beating the odds? Crickette susan_02143
